doctor_sentences.text: The patient presents with intermittent angina and a positive troponin I of zero point three six nanograms per milliliter.
Post-operative pathology confirmed a stage two-A adenocarcinoma of the sigmoid colon.
We started ceftriaxone, two grams given intravenously every twenty-four hours, for suspected bacterial meningitis.
Her hemoglobin A-one-C has stabilized at seven point one percent after switching to semaglutide.
Magnetic resonance imaging revealed a three-centimeter demyelinating plaque in the periventricular white matter.
The echocardiogram shows an ejection fraction of thirty-five percent with global hypokinesis.
Give zero point four milligrams of sublingual nitroglycerin as needed if chest pain is not relieved by rest.
His B-N-P is one thousand two hundred forty picograms per milliliter, consistent with decompensated heart failure.
We documented a Mallampati class three airway before intubation.
She is allergic to fluoroquinolones and developed Stevens-Johnson syndrome after taking ciprofloxacin.
Colonoscopy identified a sessile serrated lesion in the transverse colon, removed with a cold snare.
Start methylprednisolone, one gram intravenously each day, for acute optic neuritis.
The infant’s Apgar scores were eight and nine at one and five minutes, respectively.
Arterial blood gas shows a P-A-O-two of fifty-five millimeters of mercury on room air, indicating moderate hypoxemia.
Doppler ultrasound detected a non-compressible femoral vein, consistent with deep venous thrombosis.

claim_sentences.text: Current Procedural Terminology code nine three three zero six for transthoracic echocardiography was partially denied because modifiers were missing.
International Classification of Diseases, tenth revision, code J forty-five point nine zero nine was flagged as unspecified asthma; a documentation update was requested.
The member’s deductible was met, so the three-hundred-twenty-dollar coinsurance on H-C-P-C-S code J seventeen forty should be waived.
The pharmacy rejected the G-L-P-one authorization because the prior authorization expired on June thirtieth, twenty twenty-five.
Diagnosis-related group three-thirty payment was reduced due to a coding discrepancy with a secondary diagnosis of hypokalemia.
We need operative notes to support Current Procedural Terminology code two nine eight eight one for arthroscopic medial meniscectomy.
The E-O-B shows a coordination-of-benefits adjustment after the Medicare crossover.
Modifier twenty-five was omitted on the evaluation and management service, causing bundling with the injection.
An out-of-network penalty applied because N-P-I one two one five nine eight three seven four six lacks a single-case agreement.
Denial code C-O one ninety-seven cites missing pre-certification for the lumbar laminectomy.
The ambulance claim billed A zero four two eight, but mileage code A zero four two five was missing, triggering partial payment.
The appeals team requests a radiology report to validate Current Procedural Terminology code seven four one seven seven for computed tomography of the abdomen and pelvis with contrast.
The prosthetic hip device falls under H-C-P-C-S code L eight six nine nine, which is not covered without a K modifier.
Claim edits routed Current Procedural Terminology nine six three seven two to incidental when billed with nine nine two one four on the same date of service.
The high-cost threshold was exceeded; specialty medication coded J three four nine zero requires National Drug Code submission.
